column4: hi, does anybody know, how i can set a system-wide /CHARSET ISO-8859-15

if you look at the mount man page you can see the options for mounting various filesystems with different character sets

you are trying to mount your filesystem with another character set, right?

your linux filesystem will be utf8 encoded. you can mount an ntfs/fat partition with another character encoding, which is set as a mount parameter. however, none of this has anything to do with the character encoding of the files themselves on the filesystem, only the encoding used for the file names
